Title: Pinetree Lodge, romantic getaway in the Cotswolds
Description: pinetree lodge is a romantic high end luxury cotswold getaway nestled in its own small enclosed wood on our active working farm its outside living at its finest with a well equipped outdoor kitchen fire pit with accessories to cook a beautiful bbq roast or chilli a gas bbq also provided for ease an efficient wood burner provides ample warmth on colder evenings and during the winter months the kitchen is basic a little gas stove gives for a nice cuppa and a breakfast fry up indoors the space the spacenthe lodge has been a dream of mine for years and a wonderful australian couple have made my dream a reality literally from a pencil drawing i gave them on a scrap of paper they lovely created my beautiful bespoke cosy luxury tiny home where guests can unwind and have a wonderful time away from the rest of the worldnnthe small wood its has been built in is only a short distance from the hustle and bustle of the farm but this only adds to the feeling of being out in the true and very real countryside there are sunsets most evenings and footpaths that run straight from your door gorgeous cotswold villages to visit and scrummy places to eatnnits definitely a place all to yourself a space in the heart of the countryside to enjoy for the majority its peaceful and tranquil but maybe with an occasional visit from the young friendly farm sheep dog woody or the hum drum of the tractor beavering away nature at its bestnnits conveniently close to all local amenities without knowing it we have 2 great pubs fabulous local butchers and shop with all you need you are close to all the most beautiful cotswold villages chipping campden broadway my favourite bourton on the water moreton in the marsh stow on the wold your local town is stratford upon avon shakespeares birth place national trust gardens hidcote gardens and privately owned gardens at kiftsgate court where the famous kiftsgate rose comes fromnnthere is so much to do in the area and places to see

Title: Hillside hideout in the Upper Wye Valley
Description: cosy cabin for 2 with a natural swimming pond views of hay bluff surrounded by countryside and walks the space the spacenguests have exclusive use of the cabin private deck and washroom separate building that has a kitchen area with sink extra fridge and a separate room with wc wash basin and large walkin showernthe garden natural swimming pond paddocks and woodland are open to all to enjoy guest access guest accessnthe cabin is located at the owners small holding set in 10 acres with a stream woodland and paddocks that are grazed by 4 friendly shetland ponies other things to note other things to notenthe washroom which consists of a kitchen area shower room with toilet facilities are located in a separate building a short walk from the cabin next to where your car will be parkednnthe cabin itself doesnt have running water its has a small sink and drinking water running hot and cold water along with a full sink and drainer are located in the washroom nearbynnthe cabin is heated by an efficient wood burner with firewood provided there is also a portal heater in the washroom that can be used in the cabin if needednnyour host also lives at the property in the farmhouse

Title: Cosy Glamping Pod with private Hot Tub
Description: the ludlow pod is nestled snugly in the south shropshire hills area of outstanding natural beautynsituated alongside a working farm with plenty of walks from the doorstep this cosy glamping pod provides the perfect escape to relax and unwindnthe accomodation has been individually designed and furnished in a bespoke style to provide you with a restful stay with a private hot tub includednluxury 100 cotton bed linen and towels are provided along with tea coffee sugar the space the spacenwet room with showerndouble induction hob and microwave oven with grillndouble bed with hybrid memory foam mattressn32 led freesat tvnfree wifinall year round heatingnoutdoor decking areanuninterrupted views other things to note other things to notentravel cot high chair available for 10 per stayniron ironing board available for 5 per stay

Title: Stylish House By The River To Escape & Relax
Description: the property include a comfortable king size bed fully equipped kitchen and bathroom tv and internet and car parking facilities all the architectural details have been created by our talented local designer to produce for you a relaxing interior style using natural and sustainable materials to inspire an earthy feeling without forgetting all the modern comforts you need the space the spacenotters restnnyou will be immersed in beautiful nature and surrounded by the sound of the water you can enjoy the tranquillity of our award nominated eco house with two lovely covered terraces for a nice weekend retreat where you can read a book or just relax with a cup of teannotters rest is located in clitheroe lancashire in the grounds of a listed building built in 1795 with a long history associated with the lancashire cotton millsnnwe are at the edge of the town so whilst you are secluded all the amenities are within just 10 min walk this area of the ribble valley is very beautiful and sits at the edge of the forest of bowland with stonyhurst college only 15 minutes away downham and other picturesque villages are very close for you to visit and enjoy for walks and visiting the wonderful pubsnnit is an ideal base for visiting friends in the area for a walking holiday or for just the peace and quiet to have a break from chaotic cities if you are a foodie the ribble valley is peppered with gastronomic experiences to suit all pockets clitheroe is a really charming old town with individual shops a market and even a microbrewery situated in the beautifully converted holmes mill just a short walk from the housennfor a very different and very special experience try our little paradise other things to note

Title: Beautiful Handcrafted Cedar Lodge with Hot Tub
Description: this beyond the average bespoke 2020 build is ultimately pleasing to the eye with its curvaceous smoothed oak rail staircase handsome pillars and waxy satin cedar beams which embrace this appealing handcrafted lodge an open plan living area leads onto 2 bedrooms with beautiful ensuites sitting in a field amongst the vivid greens of the shropshire hills on an expanse of decking where you can open up the bifold doors and bring the outside in and enjoy the deliciously warm hot tub the space the spacensunlight floods the stylish rooms showing off the gorgeous comfy furnishings a log burner sits in the living area where you can hunker down on a winters day an eclectic style kitchen of chunky wood and midnight blue cupboards with an accent of copper is well equipped the honey hues of the king size oak four poster bed with its enticing plump bedding leading to wide opening bifold doors out onto a balcony with mesmerising views the ensuite bathroom is luxuriant with its double rainfall shower heads two sinks and heated floor the second bedroom is welcoming with its deliciously comfy bed which cleverly can a king size double or two singles the perfectly conceived ensuite has a heated floor and a shower to die for in a field amongst an abundance of fruit blossom in the spring and broad leafy woods in the summer this alluring place is tantalising in its serenity and you cant help but fall into its bewitching peaceful rhythm guest access guest accessna private track lined by oak and sycamore trees will bring you up to a gravel parking area where you can unload and take the well lit footpath to the lodge we have 9 acres of private woodland with tracks for you to use right outside your front door and a field with the river onny at the bottom which is easily accessible other things to note other things to notenthere is no extra charges for fire wood and kindling or use of the hot tub the hot tub will be ready for use on your arrival with towels along with bathroom towels hand towels and bed linen we provide a welcome pack this includes tea coffee sugar milk butter eggs homemade loaf of bread and jam toilet rolls are provided soap powder and softener for washing machine along with washing up liquid

Title: Luxurious log cabin & private indoor hot tub!
Description: our luxurious log cabin is close to familyfriendly activities public transport countryside and river walks public footpaths and country pub restaurantnnthe log cabin is great for solo adventurers couples families with kids and furry friends pets and business travellers its an ideal location for unwinding with friends or familynnthe secluded hot tub is a touch of luxury for your exclusive use during your stay operating all year round it is usually hot and ready for your arrival the space the spacenyoull love the peaceful ambiance the light the sunsets and the dark starry nights the outdoor space with fully enclosed garden provides a secure environment for both pets and childrennnnature lovers will enjoy the birdsong during the day and often owls and sometimes nightingales at night not to mention the freeranging chickens affectionate cats and nearby a couple of friendly pygmy goats guest access guest accessnyou will have full and exclusive use of the cabin its private garden with bbq and of course the indoor hot tub other things to note other things to notena hot tub is fully operational and available for the exclusive and private use of guests staying in the log cabin

Title: Canadian Log Cabin with Hot Tub
Description: our brand new traditional canadian log cabin sits at the top of the mountain overlooking the ceiriog valley and berwyn mountains it is ideal for romantic breaks or just to relax and unwind making use of your own private hot tub after long walks in the hills a mere four miles from llangollen youll find a great base to make the most of all the fantastic outdoor activities and places to visit that we have to offer in the local area and further afield in north wales cheshire and shropshire guest access guest accessnguests have access to a spacious garden and an undercover private hot tub spa which is right next to the cabin and exclusively for use of guests of the cabin other things to note other things to notenwelcome packnnwe provide a welcome pack for guests generally consisting of a few tea bags and some coffee so that you can have a brew on arrival without having to worry about unpacking all of your stuff along with other homemade produce dependant on whats in season and what ive been cooking baking a slice of cake or maybe some jam may be availablennall said and done if theres anything at all that you need during your stay please dont hesitate to come and ask us and we will always do our best to helpnnwifinwe are currently without wifi nnpetsnnwith pets of our own we understand how much people like to bring them on holiday therefore we do accept one well behaved pet on requestnnfor this we make a small charge of 35 for three nights staynfor four nights plus we make a 50 charge which is payable on arrival pleasennwe also ask our guests please not to leave their pets unsupervised in the log cabin as they can become quiet stressed in a strange environmentnnany questions please dont hesitate to drop us a message

Title: Cabin In The Heart Of The New Forest
Description: social distancing to a t nlittle gate house is an idyllic country retreat for couples in the heart of the new forest national park a cosy selfcontained cabin with enclosed gardensouth facing elevated position with gorgeous viewsthe new forest is literally on the doorstep but yet there is easy access to visit the nearby towns villages cities and beachesnfab pub2 cafes 1 with farm shop all an easy walkn1 dog allowed 25 total payable in cashn10 off week staysnmin 3 nights the space the spacen in light of the covid 19 pandemic id like to reassure my guests that i have a very high standard of cleanliness and i clean and disinfect all surfaces the bathroom the kitchen and high touch surfaces such as handles tv remotes light switches etc the bedding and towels are washed at 60 degrees and i will remove all scatter cushions and blankets if youd like me to however i do spray them with a disinfectant spray we are positioned in the middle of the countryside where you dont have to come into contact with anybody else if you dont wish to you have more chance of meeting a wild pony its self check in so you dont even have to have any contact with me i even disinfect the keynif you book and then we are put into a lockdown during your booked dates in the first instance i would hope that you would consider postponing your stay and changing your dates however if this is not an option for you and you need to cancel then i would instruct airbnb to issue you a full refundnnlength of stay discounts automatically applied up to 10 off for week staysnnlate booking discounts automatically appliednnplease contact me if your required dates wont fit in sometimes there is some flexibilitynnplease let me know if youre booking to celebrate a special occasionnnfirst load of kindling and logs included but thereafter charged at 5 per loadnnno extra cleaning fee or security depositnchargednnfeel free to bring a bbqnnextra charge of 25 in total for a dog payable in cash during your stay please enquire if youd like to bring more than one dognncontactless check in just book and arrivennlittle gate house is located a short drive up a forest gravel track set on its own in the corner of our 3 acre grounds providing visitors with a high degree of privacy and peace the site once formed part of ibsley raf base during world war ii and little gate house was one of the original maycrete buildings the block of stables that you look out onto is the old latrine block and a couple of stanton air raid shelters are in the paddock literally to the rear of the cabin is the open new forest providing a whopping 140000 acres of stunning landscape to explore horse riders frequently go by as well as wildlife such as the new forest ponies cattle donkeys deer foxes badgers and an abundance of birds such as owls woodpeckers and buzzards which are often seen circling above the trees during the summer monthsnnwell designed the little gate house provides a compact yet light and airy space inside the heated and fully insulated bespoke cabin youll find all the comforts you would expect from luxury selfcatering accommodation living room open plan with fully equipped kitchendining area with full height ceilings a woodburning stove and double french doors opening onto a large area of southfacing decking cosy bijou double bedroom with full height builtin wardrobe and extra storage space above the bed useful for storing bags etc ensuite bathroom with overbath shower basin electric ladder radiator and toilet wooden floors throughout many guests have described little gate house as being small but perfectly formed and equipped with everything you need enclosed private garden to the side of the cabin ideal for your dog to stretch their legsnnalthough guests have the convenience of access straight onto the new forest there is also quick and easy access to all main roads for visitors to explore the many villages towns cities and beaches that hampshire dorset and wiltshire have to offernnriding stables 10 min drive watersportsfishing 2 miles awardwinning hockeys farm shop and caf 10 min walk the lovely royal oak thatched pub and restaurant 20 min walk the potting shed caf at hyde 20 min walk highly recommend closed on mondays ringwood with a waitrose lidl and sainsburys 5 miles and fordingbridge with a coop and tesco express 25 milesnplease see getting around section for walking directions to local farm shop pub and cafenn please have a look through the house rules and its important you follow my directions to find us easily guest access guest accessnthe entire space it is for the sole private use of our guests other things to note other things to notenwe have dual band wifi if your device gives you the choice then please select gate house 5g if not then gate house 24g the password is touchwood however us country folk dont have as good a wifi as city folk so please be mindful of this we have recently had a new router fitted and fibre optic brought all the way to the house so touchwood so far the wifi has been greatnnour property is accessed from a gravel track which has two ends one end has a ford which is passable 90 of the year when we have had an extreme amount of rain the ford may be too deep to drive through but there is access by coming in and out the other end of the track our property is 02 mile from the ford end and 05 mile from the other end general maintenance is carried out on the track a few times a year come in through the electric gates and the little gate house will be directly in front of you on the left hand side

Title: Remote Retreat in private field, ideal for dogs
Description: stay in our beautifully crafted wooden shepherds hut set in your own private south facing field next to the river surrounded by rolling green hills this is the perfect ecogetaway with solar powered electricity and extensive outdoor space enjoy the elegant interior furnishings and cosy wood stove and explore the many walks on offer directly from your doorstepnideal for dog owners hikers cyclists and nature lovers or anyone looking to get away from the normal hustle and bustle of life the space the spacenthe shepherds hut has been lovingly crafted and furnished to provide a uniquely stylish and cosy retreat showcasing the natural wood and slate furniture that we make for a living the space contains cleverly designed table and benches that slide out from under the bed for spacious indoor dining and lots of hidden storage for your belongingsnthe shepherds hut has been very well insulated and even on the coldest winter days you will be dry and toasty inside with the wood burner and the gaspowered shower no need to bring wood we have a healthy pile for you to usenthere is a toilet and shower attached to the back of the cabin with spectacular viewsnenjoy your breakfast at the table outside and maybe spot the grey heron flying in to catch his food from the river in the evening you can sit outdoors around a bonfire to gaze at the stars and listen out for the owls or watch the moon rise over the fields from your comfy bednkeep your eyes pealed for badgers and otters and enjoy guaranteed peace and quiet and connection to naturenthere is no wifi but there is mobile phone receptionnparking is available close to the hut either by our house or a short walk on the other side of the hedge guest access guest accessnthe shepherds hut is in your own private south facing field with fire pit and picnic tablenwe ask for a donation towards wood for bonfiresnwe have a second shepherds hut in its own field round the corner the two huts are private from one another and there is no shared land between themndepending on the time of year you might get fresh eggs from our hens veg from the polytunnel or a selection of pickyourown berries

Description: the stretton pod is nestled snugly in the south shropshire hills area of outstanding natural beautynsituated alongside a working farm with plenty of walks from the doorstep this cosy glamping pod provides the perfect escape to relax and unwindnthe accomodation has been individually designed and furnished in a bespoke style to provide you with a restful stay with a private hot tub includednluxury 100 cotton bed linen and towels are provided along with tea coffee sugar the space the spacenwet room with showerndouble induction hob and combination microwaveovengrillndouble bed with hybrid memory foam mattressn32 led freesat tvnfree wifinall year round heatingnoutdoor decking areanuninterrupted views other things to note other things to notentravel cot high chair available for 10 per stayniron ironing board available for 5 per stay

Title: Beautiful Cosy Cabin (No.3) - Close to Yarmouth
Description: thinking about a spring summer holiday in 2022 why not booking one of our log cabins our cabins make a great base for exploring the beautiful isle of wight fully insulated double glazed and heated for all year round use suitable for couples or small families the space the spacenthis cabin opened in july 2020 and is beautifully finished with high quality furnishings and fittings making your stay as welcoming and comfortable as possible upon entering the grounds guests take the private track to an undercover parking area wander down the bark path and enter through french doors into the kitchen lounge the cabin has a fully fitted kitchen with microwave oven with grill fridgefreezer toaster and induction hob all crockery and cutlery are supplied the cabin also has a cafetiere for your morning coffeenrelax on the comfortable lshaped sofa bed in front of the 32 tv watch one of the many dvds provided or enjoy a glass of wine whilst playing a board gamenthe separate shower room has fantastic water pressure providing an invigorating shower in a lovely corner unit together with a basin and flushing wc soap and towels providednthrough the door on the left hand side is a comfortable double bed with a quality mattress and topper all prepared with freshly washed bedding for your arrival the comfy double sofa bed with topper has all bedding supplied and is ideal for children or adultsnyou can dine at the table inside the cabin or enjoy the outdoors and eat at the picnic table next to your cabin there is also a gravel area next to the picnic table for use with disposable bbqs these can be purchased on site if requirednplease note we do not allow smoking vaping or pets on site guest access guest accessnwe have 3 cabins on site all with their own grass and eating areanguests have the whole cabin to themselves and are free to enjoy several acres of outside space around them guests have access to the whole site of approximately 3 acres other things to note other things to notenon site under cover parking is provided for cars and bicycles please note only one car per cabinnhighly recommended and award winning local family pub restaurant the horse groom is within walking distance approximately 1 mile away serving breakfasts lunch dinner and sunday lunch the pub also has a childrens outside play area prebooking definitely recommended

Title: Log Cabin Snowdonia
Description: last min cancellation for xmas to covid nights of 24 29 dec now available nnlovely cosy little log cabin in the centre of snowdonia perfect for 2 can sleep 3 plus room for a travel cot if needed with a fully equipped kitchen dining living area shower room ideal for active getaways romantic breaks or a family holiday the cabin is close to forests mountains just 20 mins drive to the seasidenn2 night min booking at xmas new year bank hols longer min stay applies the space the spacen covid19 update airbnb have imposed a covid sanitisation clean between each booking and this is mandatory we are now having to apply a cleaning fee to all bookings to cover this due to the remote nature of the cabin this requires a 20 mile round trip for a cleaner this is to cover the sanitisation clean only and guests are still required to clean up after themselves during their stay cleaning products are providednn please note for hygiene reasons we dont provide any linens bedding including bed sheets pillows duvets and towels tea towels cleaning cloths guests will need to bring their ownnnwe are very fond of our little cabin and have aimed to create somewhere that is well equipped welcoming and as many of our guests say a home from home we certainly love spending time there as an escape from everyday life and we hope youll love it as much as we donnour self catering cabin was fully refurbished in 2016 and has a fully equipped kitchen living area with tv freesat 2 bedrooms 1 double 1 single note this is a fold out single bed and a shower roomnnthe kitchen should be fully equipped with all you need to make a 3 course dinner or just a nice bacon sarnie in the morning we try to keep the cupboards stocked with a few basics coffee tea tomato ketchup salt pepper etc just in case there is a small shop on site if you need any basic supplies toonnat the start of 2017 the cabin had a new fully insulated external cladding added to it in late 2019 we had the roof insulated also which is keeping everyone warmer in winter and cooler in summer however please remember that cabin is a simple wood construction so it most likely wont be as warm in winter as your home is so we do ask people to pack a few warmer clothes definitely some slippers and maybe use it as an excuse to get cosy under a blanket with someonennmobile signal has improved drastically in the past few years and we are able to easily stream films shows to our devices using 4g perfect for a lazy day in bed weve also been able to work remotely here as the connection is strong enough to support video callsnnwe also have a large supply of dvds and books in the cabin for cold or wet days that you might not want to go out so stay in and curl up on our big sofas guest access guest accessnthe place is all yours during your stay and in addition to this theres a small shop launderette great after a day mountain biking or hill walking well equipped playground on site sadly the pub on site was devastated by a huge fire in oct 2018 and will be closed for the foreseeable future whilst it is rebuilt as its grade ii listed though this is taking some time to get sortednwe can recommend alternative venues and taxis please ask us for more info or check the guidebook at the cabinnnlarger shops supermarkets and all tourist attractions are accessible by car most things are about 20 mins drive away a perfect opportunity to take in the scenery there is a dedicated space for car parking right outside the cabin so parking should never be an issue other things to note other things to notencheck in is at 3 pm and check out is at middaynnat the cabin itself theres no wifi currently due to the location there is a mobile mast on the site now though so mobile signal has been greatly improved and is good enough to stream sky netflix etc or work remotely and do video callsnndue to restrictions from snowdonia national park we are obliged to close for the month of novembernnwe require all guests to have a history of positive feedback from previous hosts so please note if you are new to airbnb or have littleno reviews we are unlikely to accept your booking as we are not on site we like to have extra confidence in the bookings please dont take this personally

Title: The Delightful Tadpole Shepherds Hut, Somerset
Description: the tadpole hut offers the perfect cosy autumn escapennrelax under the stars you can see them from your pillow as you enjoy a break from the routine in a truly beautiful part of south somersetnnthis luxury bolthole is the perfect jumping off point for exploring the areas natural beauty and quirky wonders though you may prefer to snuggle up in front of the log burnernnbrand new in 2021 the tadpole is well insulated with sheep wool and to ensure you are warm whatever the weather the space the spacenthe tadpole was hand built in 2021 by local craftsmen at blackdown shepherd huts in nearby ilminster to the highest standards it is fitted with an electric shower small fridge twin induction hob water boiler tap wood burning stove electric radiator and a dropdown double bed the contents are of an equally high standard and include such thoughtful touches as a mobile phone charging pad smart speaker and a range of board games wifi is fast and reliable and the views across the valley are stunning especially at sunrise when the mist sometimes gathers the garden is fabulous with outside seating and a wildlife pond complete with frogs and newts guest access guest accessnthe tadpole sits on the edge of the small pretty village of kingston with its stone cottages and farmhouses gastro pub and community shop parking is available off road a few metres from the hut

Title: The Otterford Retreat -The Blackdown Hills -HotTub
Description: welcome to the beautiful blackdown hills we are conveniently located between taunton wellington and honiton in a quiet area of outstanding natural beauty and set in 8 acresnnour aim to try and share our little piece of green countryside with our guests and create a place to relax in comfort away from your everyday cares and stressnnnthis is the sister unit to the oak escape and both can be booked together to create space for parties of up to 8 the space the spacenour small studiohouse has been built to latest standards ensuring warmth and comfort during your stay we have kept the pod as simple as possible making it ideal for couples and young families the place has been fitted out with all the comforts of home with brands we all know and trust the hot tub is here for you to enjoy as you wish bathrobes and luxury white company towels will keep you warm afterwardsnn40 ins tv with dvd and roberts music system will help entertain on those cold dark winter nights when the views have been covered for the daynnthe shower room is stocked with everything you will need during your stay with a mira shower to reinvigorate while your towel is warmed on the electric towel railnnthe kitchen is compact but fully functioning with ovenfridge freezer and 2 ring hob top the oven can also be used as a microwave if coffee is your indulgence the nespresso machine is there and fully stocked for you to sample the different flavours on offernnfor the energetic guests we have 2 adult bikes located at the pod please bring your own helmetsnnwith our changeable weather you can decide to eat inside or out with the tables and chairs we have provided the weber bbq is also in situation on the deck when required we do put away during the winter but available on requestnnwireless charging is available along with a docking port for the iphone with usb plugs available at the bedsides other things to note other things to notenwe have tried to put everything we would want in a holiday stay into the house however if something is not available please ask and we will do our best to provide

Title: King's Cabin with covered private hot tub
Description: located in an unspoiled corner of north devon and nestled in undisturbed ancient woodland with outstanding valley views sits wampford woodland retreat our luxury cabin comes beautifully crafted and styled insideout with many features including a private hot tub this is the perfect idyllic retreatnwampford woodland retreat offers a peaceful and quiet setting yet is only 30 minutes from the coastline our cozy cabin is the perfect getaway to enjoy a wood cabin holiday here in devon the space the spacenwampford woodland retreat offers a unique luxury way to get away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life amazing views await you at your wooden cabin and if you wish to wander and explore feel free to do so with over 50 acres of ancient woodland along the river mole to enjoynyour private hot tub awaits you on your large front balcony and behind the cabin you will find an impressive hammock perfect for stargazing in and sipping your favourite beverage with your favourite person bliss other things to note other things to notensensible shoes reccomended for the walk from the car park to the cabin

Title: Idyllic countryside cabin with stream and lake.
Description: relax in this beautiful quirky cabin which was completed in 2021nnexposed beams arched doors and a wood burner the master bedroom has an ensuite and behind a bookshelf is a hidden bunk roomnnguests can enjoy 3 acres of private grounds with a stream bubbling through it and a lake with jetty and rowing boatnnhot tub available upon request and at extra costnndogs welcomennbampton is a lovely foodie village just five minutes walk awaynnattractions nearbynncheckinout monday or friday the spacenapplejacks is a charming cosy gem which is accessed through private gates off a country lane and down a drive to the former stone sheep barn which is full of wood and rustic features it is laid out as followsnninsidenporchboot room with hand made sheep mosaic on the floor and store cupboard with washing machinennthe main living area has high ceilings exposed oak features and a wood burnerbaking stove with two comfy chairs and colourful bean bags at one end there is a writing table that is perfect for anyone needing to work on a laptop at the other end is a rustic dining table dresser and brand new kitchen microwave dishwasher there is a dulcimer should guests wish to learn a medieval string instrumentnnthe master bedroom is entered through an arched door there is an ensuite bathroom with walk in shower you can hear the trickle of the stream as you fall asleepnnbehind the bookshelf leading off the lounge is a small secret bunk bed room with colourful wallpaper perfect for kids or extra guestsnnthere is a cloakroomtoilet off the loungennoutsidenfrench doors lead out onto a large partially covered hardwood deck with comfortable sofas on one side and an oak dining table on the other view of the stream and surrounding nature and complete privacy the barn is surrounded in formal lawns and there are also three acres of private grounds for guests to exclusively explore and enjoy why not sit around a fire and cook marshmallowsnnnext to the stream is a two person oak swing seat and pond it is a perfect spot for enjoying the sight and sounds of the stream or to watch the kids play in the waternnacross a stone bridge is a small orchard and grasslands at the other end of the field guests can discover a lake with a path running around it there is a jetty and rowing boat for guests to use at their own risknnguests can enjoy outdoor fires and there is also a clay oven perfect for pizzas meat and jacket potatoesnnthere is another picnic table in the fieldnnnadditionallynnhot tub upon request and at extra chargenndogs are welcome but not in bedrooms or on furniturenngood wifinnlogs are providednnoutdoor showernnshort breaks check inout fridays and mondaysnnno tvnntowels and bed linen providednnparking for two carsnnall ground floor apart from one step from porch into the barnnnwashing machinennhighchair and cot bednnhairdryernnlinentowels providednnpayment by bank transfer please guest access guest accessnprivate parking for two cars next to the property other things to note other things to notenthe lake and stream are not fenced off so children must be accompanied at all times there is a rowing boat for guest to use but it is done so completely at the guests risk and should not be used by anyone under 18nnplease note that sometimes sheep are in the field so dogs should be kept under control at these times thank you

Title: Cabin Morgan at Efyrnwy Escapes, Pontrobert, Powys
Description: setup with everything you may need including bedding and towels with a double bedroom bathroom and sofa bed this is perfect for a romantic hide away bolt hole or a place for family adventure fully equipped kitchen including fridgefreezer slow cooker microwave cosy logburner and a stocked wood store dining inside or out on the decking tables and chairs are provided and a private bbq and firepit on the seated patio area for those late summer nights stargazing with a nice glass of wine the space the spacencabin morgan is set back from a quiet lane on a smallholding between the peaceful villages of pont robert and meifod tranquil and idyllic with stunning views of the rolling hills of wales it has 10 acres of private farmland to stroll around locally designed with solar power filtered water from a bore hole and local welsh sheep providing wool insulation this wooden cabin provides a more environmentally thoughtful way to stayndogs are welcome at a fee of 5 on arrival and bydb bring your own dog bed one well behaved dog is extremely welcome but please contact us should you have morenwe have tried to make the cabin feel like a home from home a welcome pack with the basics tea coffee milk bread and bacon etc will be waiting for you on your arrival to start you on your holiday please let us know of any special requests eg soya milk or gluten free bread

Title: Beautiful Lake House near Shrewsbury, Shropshire
Description: set amidst beautiful shropshire countryside and sat overlooking an amazing lake the stunning market towns of shrewsbury and church stretton are only a ten minute drive while ludlow can be reached in around 20 minutes beautiful surroundings set on a tranquil lake near to the shropshire hills with plenty of walks including the times number one walk for the 2018 new year being from picklescott which is just 2 miles up the lane search the times 20 great walks for the new year on the internet the space the spacenwith beautiful surroundings and set on a tranquil lake our log cabin has 1 large bedroom with a separate bathroom and an open plan kitchendininglounge area plenty of space outside with its private parking and wrap around veranda to enjoy the views of the lakes from it has been beautifully decorated and furnished by a local interior designer to a high standardthere is cake tea coffee milk and sugar waiting for you on your arrival guest access guest accessnyou can walk around the lakes but please do not use the owners private garden area

Title: Arraslea (3) Two Person Cabin with private Hot Tub
Description: our cabins are set in 12 acres of private land that we use for our heavy horsesnwe have three cabins and they all have their own hot tubs nour site is a quiet site so no parties or loud noises a place to relax and unwind the space the spacenwe have three cabins and they are located down a drive surrounded by heavy horses and countryside great walks from the cabins other things to note other things to notenwe allow only one well behaved dog in our cabin but due to having live stock and electric fences we ask that dogs are kept on a lead and alway clear up after your dog xnnever leave your dog unattended in the cabin at any time

Title: Willow Log Cabin - Sleeping 2 - Hot Tub - Suffolk
Description: willow log cabin is a perfect escape in this tranquil setting in rural suffolk here at kingfishers cretingham this lodge offers open plan living with a hot tub in the secluded private garden where guests can enjoy the beautiful surroundingsnnthis spacious one bedroom log cabin is perfectly situated within our stunning 120 acres of country park it is ideal for up to two guests the ensuite has a roll top bath with separate shower basin and wc the space the spacenguests can enjoy the peace and tranquility offered here at kingfishers yet have plenty to do both on their doorstep and within a short drive or cyclennfrom your doorstep you can enjoy a 9 hole parkland golf course restaurant cafe kayak and boat hire and nature trail kingfishers really does offer the very best of the suffolk countryside not a vehicle noise or street lamp in sight yet only 30 minutes from the amazing coastal towns of aldeburgh and southwold 20 minutes from ipswich stowmarket and woodbridge and only 8 minutes to the popular town of framlingham

Title: Pebbles - escape to the coast
Description: an absolutely delightful studio lodge sitting alongside the beach in sandgate with far reaching sea views a lovely terrace and the quarterdeck for alfresco under cover dining the perfect romantic bolthole the space the spacenpebbles sleeps 2 in 1 bedroom and 1 shower room private parking for one car large terrace and covered outdoor dining areannsingle storey open plan studio with kitchen and breakfast bar king size bed wardrobe smart tvnkitchen area includes a single cooking ring microwave slow cooker fridge with ice box dishwashernensuite shower room with shower cubicle wc and basinnnoutsidena large terrace overlooking the beach with a double sun lounger beach towels are providednalso the quarterdeck a covered area with sea views ideal for outside dining with gas bbq and patio heaternprivate parking for one car directly below the property other things to notentowels and linen are providednwifincentral heatingnbbqnpets are not permittednprivate parking space for one car alongside the propertynplease note this property does not have a cooking hob or oven but the single cooking ring microwave and gas bbq provide adequate means for cookingnas pebbles is accessed via several flights of steps guests are urged to walk with care on the way to and from the propertynthe owner lives in the house at the top of the gardennplease note check in is 3pm and check out is 10am

Title: Cosy Rural Log Cabin, Near Slapton Sands
Description: a peaceful secluded light bright and warm cabin surrounded by fields with horses countryside views a mile and a half outside of picturesque slapton slapton lea nature reserve and the beach the cabin has a sofa table and chairs tv small kitchen area and a cosy bedroom at the back with a double bed and bunks it is on the edge of our playing field area and has its own fenced garden space the bathroom shower toilet and basin are in the building next door 20 yards the space the spacenthe cabin is situated in our large garden and field on the side of the valley you can be lulled to sleep with the sounds of the nature and bask in the afternoon sun that keeps the cabin naturally super cosy the cabin is simple but beautifully peaceful tranquil and the setting is idyllic u202c u202ain the cabin you will find a comfy double size bed bunk beds a sofa a small kitchen area with an area for making drinks simple suppers and breakfasts and hooks to hang clothes there is a kettle toaster a small fridge freezer mini hob mini sink with cold water tap cutlery crockery and glasses coffee tea and breakfast jars of cereal there is also a combination microwave which can be used like an oven u202c u202aall bedding is supplied along with towels and soap and there is an electric heater to keep you warm and cosy during the cooler months you may wish to bring warm socks andor slippers too there is a small tv in the cabin but perhaps you would rather immerse yourself in natureu202c

Title: Greenways Log Cabin a relaxing rural retreat
Description: greenways log cabin is a beautifully furnished rural retreat with stunning countryside views it is private airy and comfortable all furnishings and fittings are of a very high qualitynnthe log cabin sits within the owners property in its own private garden there is a key safe for contactless arrival leaving you to enjoy your break respecting your privacy the space the spacenin relation to coronavirus covid19 we are committed to airbnbs cleaning protocol between guests the log cabin is thoroughly cleaned including the use of a ultra low volume ulv fogging machine this pushes out a disinfectant in a fine mist to cover all surfaces and soft furnishings using a covid19 compliant cleaner despite restrictions easing in england with high infection rates we will be continuing with theses strict covid protocolsnnlocated on the edge of the royal forest of dean and the wye valley it is a perfect place to unwind and enjoy the surrounding countryside local cities towns and attractionsnnfrom the warm and cosy open plan living area you can enjoy farreaching countryside views or just relax while watching tvnnthere is a wellequipped kitchen complete with all the essentials you need to prepare homecooked meals fitted with an electric oven and hob microwave fridge with ice box and a dishwasher to make the log cabin a real home from homennthere is a kingsize bedroom with a comfortable brass bedstead bed and plenty of hanging and drawer space you can enjoy waking up to views of the countryside every morningnna modern showerroom with walkin shower basin and wc completes the accommodationnntake a walk on one of the many local footpaths or perhaps visit the town of newent with its traditional inns restaurants tea rooms and individual shopsnnthe historic city of gloucester and regency cheltenham are also close by visits to the riverside town of tewkesbury the honey pot towns and villages of the cotswolds and the severn vale are also a mustnnmake the most of this delightful romantic unique retreat

Title: The Water Cabin by the Nor‚ÄìFolk (Norfolk Broads)
Description: the water cabin is a recently renovated 1930s cedarclad cabin located on the bank of the river thurne in the heart of the broads national park it is the ideal retreat for a romantic getaway or family holiday at any time of the year the space the spacenthe water cabin has two bedrooms sleeps four and open plan living room kitchen and dining room the bathroom has a large walkin shower and bath outside there is a large decked area a generous sized garden and an adjacent boat dyke with river frontage and moorings the cabin has river views to the front and countryside views to the rear guest access guest accessnthe water cabin is located in the heart of the norfolk broads with boat hire country walks cycle routes and nature reserves on our doorstep close by is the beach 15 mins the cathedral city of norwich 30 mins and north norfolk 45 mins other things to note other things to notenwe are located on the river so highly recommend hiring life jackets especially if you have childrennnparking for one car is provided closeby but please note the water cabin is reached by foot via a concrete path for the last 200300 meters we will provide a trolley to easily transport your luggage from your car to the cabinnnunfortunately because of the remote location narrow uneven paths and the fact the water cabin is a 1930s structure were unable to offer full disabled access and facilities if you have any specific questions about the accessibility of the water cabin please contact us to ask we will do our utmost to help

Title: Peaceful, Relaxing, Great views - Forest of Dean.
Description: the lodge is newly built and located in the royal forest of dean in our own grounds separate from the main house it has a spacious lounge kitchen area there is a large bedroom with ensuite and super king bed or option of 2 singles benefits include a large patio for guests with views across the countryside ideal for those who want a relaxing break there is access to the forest from the garden gate social distancing comes naturally in the woods parking is within security gates the space the spacenthe lodge is ideally suited to explore the forest of dean with miles of offroad walks and cycle tracks there are plenty of local places to eat and tourist attractions nearby such as taurus crafts puzzle wood clearwell caves and steam railways gloucester quays and chepstow are about 20 miles drive or by train from lydney station guest access guest accessnguests have their own designated patio and garden area and parking space the hosts garden is out of sight within their acre of grounds and their dogs are kept separate from the guests area other things to note other things to notenthe lodge also offers respite breaks to carers we value their commitment and dedication the hosts have not received any money from central government for this project instead they rely on the generosity of individuals such as yourself who are paying guests when you stay a percentage of money paid subsidises future carers staying at the lodge experiencing a well deserved peaceful retreat

Title: Luxury Cottage & Fairytale Garden near Hay-on-Wye
Description: price is inclusive of 15 airbnb fee and cleaning feesnnnestled between the thriving literary town of hayonwye and the stunning black mountains of brecon beacons national park this property with its fairytale garden and babbling brook is the best of both worlds spend quality time with family and friends in both town and country with beautiful walks and outdoor activities aplenty as well as bookshops galleries and restaurants just minutes away there really is something for everyone the space the spacentucked away in a charming village and surrounded by woodland walnut tree cottage is a traditional welsh stone cottage dating from 1881 with a modern extension housing a large master suite and a bright airy kitchennnfrench doors lead to a fairytale garden bursting with flowers herbs and fruit in the summer guests can listen to the babbling brook which leads to an 8ft waterfall explore the peaceful woodland and make a pizza in the outdoor oven all year around expect to see kingfishers trout and even ottersnnthe cosy living room featuring a woodburner flows into the reception room and kitchen allowing guests to spend time together or apart the charming downstairs bedroom sleeps three in single beds under the eaves with space for a baby in a travel cot provided upon request a utility room contains a washerdryer iron and ironing board a familysized fridge and toys for the little ones upstairs all three bedrooms feature kingsize beds and the large master bedroom benefits from an ensuite bathroom all beds are made up with 300 thread count hotel quality linen nnthe cottage has been lovingly decorated to a high specification in a calming palette the property whilst not large is big on style with furniture and fittings from all over the worldnnwe have tried to think of everything a guest might need from shampoo soap conditioner and body lotion to laundry supplies phone chargers and stationery so you can spend more time relaxing and less time worrying about the small stuffnna carefully curated selection of books are provided for the book lovers drawn to hay as well as a range of board games for rainy daysnnwe have amenities catering for families with children including travel cot with bedding high chair childrens crockery microwave bottle steriliser stair gates bed guards baby body wash and toysnnthere is wifi throughout the property and a smarttv including netflix for rainy days nnthis property accommodates 7 people comfortably but may be booked to a maximum of 9 people subject to additional cost guest access guest accessnyou will have access to the whole cottage one wardrobe in the master suite and a number of cupboards in the utility room contain our personal belongings and supplies and are lockednnthere is space for two medium sized cars to park in the drive however there is a public right of way alongside the drive and must remain unobstructed other things to note other things to notenwhilst we provide a number of amenities for children this property has stairs sharp corners and expensive furnishings it is not baby or childproofed and children must be supervised at all times there is a brook that runs alongside the property and whilst there is not a sudden drop it is unfenced the brook ends in an 8ft waterfall and though gated a determined child would likely be able to get around it it is therefore a condition of booking that we ask all guests to accept full responsibility for supervising their children at all times

Title: The Wendy House a 1960s chalet by the sea
Description: the wendy house a traditional 1960s cedar wood chalet that was renovated in 2017 beautifully furnished in a luxurious yet wendy house style magical for children stuffed full of lovely vintage things it is situated in a very sunny corner of a quiet family run site 10 minutes stroll to the beach near great pubs perfect after a beach walk warm and cosy no wifi have a detox talk walk play games recharge restni really do try and make it special for you come and stay the space the spacencovid updatento keep you your family and myself as safe as possible during this unprecedented time the wendy house will have to look a little different inside following government guidelines anything that cannot be properly cleaned will be removed from the property sadly this will mean toysgamesleaflets etc a different type of welcome pack will also be left but please be reassured that when you enter the wendy house it will be a safe environment for younnthe wendy house is a traditional 1960s chalet stuffed full of vintage and beautiful things alongside some wonderful vintage photography of heacham as a seaside resort in the 50s60s the wendy house is a very peaceful space that allows you to unplug from your busy world we have no wifi allowing you to detox from technology recharge your batteries and be mindful of whats out there againnnni personally look after the wendy house from the messages you receive right down to the cleaning and the laundry i like it this way so i can ensure that when you arrive it is all looking its beautiful best it is very suitable for families friends couples and a luxurious base for onennthe wendy house and the summerhouse can be booked together for bigger group gatheringsnni have taken my time renovating this little place which includes a beautiful natural slate floor to the kitchen and shower room wood effect tiled shower shutters to some of the windows quality pocket sprung king size bed with beautiful bed linen some pillowcases are gorgeous vintage ones i have put black out blinds to both bedrooms to aid your sleep and for little ones to sleepgiving you some quiet timennthe shower room has a wood effect shower slate floor shutters to the windows a sink and toilet it also has a large heated towel rail to keep you cosynthe kitchen is equipped with everything you need to make some lovely dinnerswith carefully chosen crockery and tableware i supply a welcome pack of a continental style breakfast to last you a couple of daysnnelectric fully programmable radiators will keep you warm when it gets chilly the chalet receives sunshine all day so you can bask in it whilst reading that book you have always wanted to read we have a super comfy corner sofa to stretch out onnnthe veranda has outdoor lighting and very comfortable natural wicker furniturennthe chalet is located in the far corner of the site to the side of the chalet there is a great place for children to make densi have included things for a mud kitchen to help them with their adventures there are a selection of traditional games and family board gamesnnmy idea for this little place is to help create a traditional seaside family holiday a quiet sharing space for friends a romantic retreat for two or a luxurious break for one all where lovely memories are madenni think it ticks all the boxesnncome and play house at the wendy housennthe wendy house turns into the winter wendy house in october i dress it with velvet cushions fur throws wintry bits and lots of candlelight safe battery operated variety making it a very special place to get in the mood for this time of year norfolk is particularly beautiful in autumn and winter the roads beaches and pubs are very much quieter the cabin is super cosy with thermostatically controlled electric radiators and the electric stove come and get all snugged up guest access guest accessnthe chalet is all for you other things to note other things to notenthe wendy house is on a site with other chalets to get to it there is approximately 100 steps from the parking area to the front doornnno dogs are allowed on the site not my rules nna basic welcome pack will be providednnno smoking in the chalet pleasennif you wish to use my highchair please book this prior to your arrival sadly due to covid it is essential to bring your own travel cotnni supply towels not beach towels tea towels cleaning products cloths hand washnni will make up the beds that will be used and a spare pack of linen on top of any beds that are not used

Title: Beautiful Lakeside Lodge with Hot Tub
Description: detached 3 bedroom luxury holiday lodge with decking and hot tub situated on misty bay on the water ski lake the lodge is in fantastic condition with double glazing and central heating you are assured a comfortable staynour lodge has a modern open plan interior with fully equipped kitchen with under counter fridge and under counter freezer microwave washer dishwasher master bedroom has a king size bed and tv en suite the second bedroom with twin beds and third with bunk beds the space the spacenthis is an ideal location to explore the varied attractions of this part of lincolnshire from leisure to heritage attractions from water sports to shopping there is something for everyonentattershall lakes holiday park you will find jet ski and water ski lakes fishing lakes a adventure playground gym swimming pool 2 restaurants and bars 2019 arrival of a splash pool and beach with sky bar all set within 360 acres of park and woodland guest entertainment passes can be obtained if you want them at guest services once you arrive guest access guest accessnyou have full use of club house swimming pool and you can book jet skis and water assault course which is great fun other things to note other things to notenall towels are not suppliednclub passes are available from office at a minimum cost

Title: Long Thatch Lodge, Old Newton, Suffolk
Description: set in the peaceful hamlet of ward green in the heart of the suffolk countryside long thatch lodge is a charming retreat for two people looking for the perfect place to enjoy a relaxing breaknnthe lodge is a great base to explore suffolks historic towns houses gardens heritage coast nature reserves and countrysidennit offers a cosy and tranquil stay with its own private garden with secluded outdoor seating areas to watch the abundant local wildlife the space the spacenguest reassurancenthe lodge is totally separate from our cottage with its own driveway entrance and garden self checkinout is available enabling you to be totally independentnwe follow airbnbs enhanced cleaning protocol which was developed with expert guidance here are a few highlightsn sanitise hightouch surfaces down to the doorknobsn use cleaners and disinfectants approved by global health agencies and wear protective gear to help prevent crosscontaminationn clean each room using extensive cleaning checklistsn provide extra cleaning supplies so you can clean as you staynshould you need any assistance or further information there is a comprehensive info guide inside the lodge as well as contact numbers should you need usnnndownstairsnfront stable door opens onto hallway with pamment brick flooring and steep paddle staircasenopen plan livingdining area and a well equipped modern kitchen including electric oven hob fridge microwave lavazza coffee machine toaster and kettlenstylish corner sofa with a large flat screen tv dvd player bluetooth speaker dab radio dining table with two chairsnbifold doors open onto a sunny decking area with outdoor light seating along with picnic tablebenches overlooking the small orchard and fields beyond in the livingdining area there is also a wood burning stove making those chillier months much cosiernnupstairsncomfortable oakbased double bed with deep tempur mattress which aids independent sleeping there is space to hang clothes and a chest of drawers as well as a wallmounted flat screen tv there is also a retro style desk electric fan for those warm nightsnthe recently redesigned bathroom has a full walk in shower hand basin with mixer tap and wcnall 100 egyptian cotton bed linen towels are providednheating throughout the lodge is electric manually adjustable with constant hot water other things to note other things to notenelectric heating and hot water is includednunlimited superfast wifi availablenwood for log burner providednself check inout using lockbox if requiredna small welcome gift is provided as well as filtered water fresh milk tea coffee sugarnalso provided for use during your visit are books dvds games puzzles and jigsaws

Title: Ash Log Cabin -Sleeps 4 - Hot Tub - in Suffolk
Description: ash log cabin is a spacious two bedroom lodge perfectly situated within our stunning 120 acres of country park at kingfishers cretingham it is ideal for up to four guests and benefits from having a secluded garden with private hot tubnnguests can enjoy the peace and tranquility offered here at kingfishers yet have plenty to do both on their doorstep and within a short drive or cyclenn1 well behaved pet accepted the space the spacenash log cabin features and open plan living area for all guests to socialise together a master bedroom with ensuite shower room a twin bedroom and a family bathroomnnfrom your doorstep you can enjoy a 9 hole parkland golf course restaurant cafe kayak and boat hire and nature trail kingfishers really does offer the very best of the suffolk countryside not a vehicle noise or street lamp in sight yet only 20 minutes from the amazing coastal towns of aldeburgh and southwold 20 minutes from ipswich stowmarket and woodbridge and only 8 minutes to the popular town of framlingham guest access guest accessnparking is outside of the log cabin and there is a key safe next to the door

Title: Misty's Place in a lovely peaceful setting
Description: mistys place is a well maintained two bedroom lodge with enclosed decking complete with outdoor seating it is secure for dogs and childrenset on bridlington links golf course in peaceful surroundings just a short walk from sewerby house gardens and zoo included in your package are four adult passes into sewerby hall and grounds east riding of yorkshire approximately 28 miles north of hull 34 miles east of york the space the spacenour well presented two bedroom 15 bathroom cabin is set in the peaceful woodland setting of bridlington links golf and leisure estate next door to the historic sewerby hall just outside the historic harbour town of bridlingtonnmistys place is a single storey open plan lodge a real home from homeit has a well stocked kitchen even jamie oliver would be impressed prepare your food looking out towards the woods you may even see a deer wandering past double doors lead out onto the enclosed decking where you can sit on the outdoor furniture and enjoy the peace and quiet while enjoying the ample wildlifena short stroll takes you to the bridlington links golf club 18 hole golf and leisure estate prices available in cabinna side gate in heritage park takes you into sewerby hall gardens and zoo remember to use your passes to access all areas included in your package there is a quaint dog and child friendly cafenthen either walk along the cliff tops or along the beach into bridlington or board the land train for a scenic trip into the town of bridlingtonnother places of interest danes dyke short drive to cayton bay filey scarborough and 32 miles from whitbynthe whole cabin is available to guests the lounge has a smart tv complete with netflix amazon and free viewdvd player small selection of films books games available the master bedroom also has smart tv with netflixamazon wi fi available

Title: Shepherd's Hut, Off-Grid, Hot Tub and Beacons View
Description: a tiny house offgrid shepherds hut with panoramic views of the spectacular brecon beacons accessed by its own gated lane and set in a private paddock oliveduck hut is the perfect retreat for couples or singles who prefer their own company an ideal base camp as you explore the national park and surrounding area light a fire and get lazy chill out in the hottub stargaze at the incredible night skies or just take in the majestic pen y fan as you plan or recover from your ascent the space the spaceninsidena uniquely designed carefully crafted and wonderfully cosy shepherds hut tiny house clad in cedar with oakframed doubleglazing the hut is set in its own paddock about 200 metres from your nearest neighbour your hosts tim and sarah the floortoceiling picture window looks out to pen y fan while a sidedoor takes you to a decked terrace that opens onto rolling pastures and an equally stunning view the hut really feels like a miniature homefromhome and is finished to a very high specification wood burning stove oak floor very comfortable doublebed gas oven and hob fridge with small ice box sink tv bluetooth speaker table and chairs and wifi dressing gowns slippers and ecowashing products are all includednnnoutsidenthe paddocks parking area and walkways are gravelled the decking terrace has a table and chairs and a weber gas bbq with grill and hot plateplancha the unheated wcshower room is only 10 metres from the hut and has a composting toilet and hot shower outside on its rear wall is a large sink with hot and cold running water theres a picnic bench on the grass a bench beneath the tree near the stream and deck chairs and not forgetting a twoperson woodfired hottub that well fill with water ahead of your arrivalnnthe paddock is located in a grazing field with a turning area established trees and hedgerows and a stream guests are welcome to use this field during their staynnoffgridnthe huts electrics are powered by solar energy and a 12v power supply there are two usb charge points and a cartype 12v socket unfortunately theres no capacity for 240v devices like hair dryers and straighteners but were happy to charge your laptops for you the 4g wifi occasionally dips to 3g the hob oven shower and bbq all run on bottled gasnnheating for the hut and hot tub comes from woodfired stoves and youll have more than enough kindling and seasoned wood to last a fire pit is available to hirenntheres hot and cold running water in the shower and outside sink please use only the ecofriendly shampoo conditioner soap and washingup liquid provided running water is available in the huts sink this runs off an electric pump supplied from canisters kept under the sink its not heated but you can fill canisters with hot water from the outside sink if you need tonnothernyou can lock bicycles or motorcycles to the base of the decking area we can supply a strong chain lock and cover please contact us in advance if you need dry secure storage

Title: Rustic Lodge, Stunning views & star gazing bath
Description: the log cabin has been created to give our guests a private peaceful cosy stay with a rustic feeling of getting away from it all there are stunning views of dartmoor from your decking where you can enjoy a glass of wine on the sofa surrounded by fur rugs pillowsnnthe combination of beaches and moorland are beautiful areas to explore with something for everyonennalternatively listen to the crackle of the log burner whilst peacefully watching your favourite movies the space the spacenyou are situated in a sheltered sunny valley where you can look down on the birds of prey flying around and the lambs chasing each other it is so very peaceful and relaxing sat on the decking soaking up the viewnnit is great to get away from it all but in case of rainy days there is also a wall mounted tv which has no areal only tv via the internet so you can enjoy net flicksamazon prime etc occasionally we can have a poor signal due to being so rural but most of the time it works fine there is wifi in the log cabinnnthe log cabin is a 20minute walk outside the village and quite rural take care driving on the lanes as they are quite narrow and challenging at times late summer into autumn is when the farmers cut the hedges which can be frustrating as this reduces the beautiful view but this is not for long and the peace and tranquillity is still surrounding younndogs are very welcome it is the perfect place for wonderful walks across dartmoor national park the garden should be secure and private for them unless they are small enough to climb through the gate please let me know if you are bringing one on your booking there is a small charge of 10 per stay if you have one or two dogs if you have more than two dogs i would be grateful if you would contact me firstnnthere is an outdoor bath for two in a private garden so you can look up at the starsnthis is my favourite place but it is not for everyone this is part of your log cabin and included in the pricennthere is a hot tub next door which is available occasionally if my cottage is not bookednplease feel free to ask and if it is available it is 25 for a two hour session i will only be able to confirm its availability when you have arrivednmy guest tell me they are loving the bath and would rather it to the hot tub other things to note other things to notenwell behaved dogs are very welcome there is a hose and a dog gate to help you keep them clean and dry if you could bring your own dog beds and keep them off your bed and the sofa i would be most gratefulnnthe double sofa bed is small which is why i have allowed for only one guest but it can fit two if you want a fourth person to stay it is an extra 10 a nightnnif you do use the sofa bed i am afraid you cannot use the log burning stove as the bed gets too close you do not need it for heating as there is a radiator anyway but it looks and smells lovely if there is just two of younnthere is an outside field kitchen under cover which consists of an small oven two hot plates and a chicken rotisserie which is amazing i am very grateful if you could leave this clean on departure to avoid a cleaning fee there is a small combination microwavecookergrill inside the log cabin toonnthe bathroom is heated by the sun and has a wonderfully hot shower in an open rustic wet room it is surprisingly pleasurable the eco loo is a type of waterless toilet that separates urine from solid waste urine can is diverted through a flexible pipe to an external soak away area this is cleaned and made fresh for all my guests and is environmentally friendlynnyou have your own two person external bath which is hidden away in your private garden with fairy lights and candles a wonderful experience you simply must trynnthere is a fire pit that you can sit around in your garden you will need to bring your own logs for this great for roasting marshmallows and can be used to bbq food but you will need to bring your own charcoal and there is no temperature control so can be challengingnnoccasionally i rent out my cottage next door too

Title: Chanctonbury View SHEPHERDS HUT with hot tub
Description: glamping is a new venture for us here at gallops farm holiday cottages we guarantee youll experience the same high standard in our glamping accommodation as our guests staying in our cottagesnnpeace and tranquillity await you in chanctonbury view our lovingly built shepherds hut sleeping two guests this cosy abode has beautiful farreaching views across to chanctonbury ringnnyoull love the luxury of your own hot tub tucked right beside the shepherds hut the space the spacenthere is an open plan livingkitchen area where you can sit and admire the view the ensuite bathroom has a relaxing rain shower the kitchen is well equipped with hob microwave fridge kettle and toaster the living area has a 32inch smart tv guest access guest accessngallops farm holiday cottages is based at gallops farm a family working farm we are situated at the top of findon village stable lane you have the benefit of being able to walk directly off the farm onto the south downs or down into the village within 20 minutes you will reach a choice of pubs and restaurants in the village other things to note other things to notenwe have been welcoming guests to gallops farm holiday cottages since 2013 glamping is a new venture for us and i take pride in ensuring every guest has the best experience during their stay

Title: The Retreat
Description: hidden away privately behind electric gates a truly delightful private parkland style setting of landscape mature gardens with views over open countryside the retreat is a perfect place to unwind the one bedroom cabin boasts a kitchenette with cooking facilities and utensils a king size bed and shower room terrace over looking natural pool and fields private parking for 2 cars or large vansnmilk tea coffee included along with cereals crumpetsntoiletries provided the space the spacencompletely private for adults only and well hidden in a beautiful mature garden with shaped lawns and pathways and a fine variety of superb specimen trees which include silver birch spruce horse chestnut and an oak tree over 400 years old the village with local pub within walking distance 3 local churches and beautiful walks ideally situated close to henleyinarden stratford upon avon close to nec and birmingham international train stations guest access guest accessnguests will use a safe box to check in you are able to park privately and securely behind electric gates you then then have the use of the entire cabin to yourself and are completely isolated other things to note other things to notenplease note the retreat is solely for adults only no children or pets

Title: Cosy log cabin with log burner, bikes and hot tub
Description: the cosy cabin is situated on the edge of the new forest perfect for bike riding walking and horse riding there are many country pubs nearby bournemouth beach is a 20 minute drive mudeford beach is a 15 minute drive where crabbing is popular nearby is the new forest wildlife park and just down the road is libertys owl raptor and reptile centre burley is only a 10 minute drive away too where theres lots to see and do the space the spacenthis space is a handcrafted log cabin made by us it is rustic and authentic downstairs is the living area with a lounge wood burner and kitchen area the bathroom is situated off the lounge upstairs is the cosy bedroom outside there is a lovely veranda where you can relax in the evening in one of the rocking chairs in the back garden there are two decking areas one has a wood fired hot tub on with slouch chairs and a little table the other decking has outdoor games beanbags blankets and two bikes for guests to use as they please with helmets also provided on the grass area there is a bbq and a small fire pit other things to note other things to notenthe log cabin is for people who enjoy natural environments with nature surrounding you from owls landing on the roof at night to the red deer running through the back field this property is located in the national park and is for outdoor people there will be spiders moths butterflies and bees anything to do with nature you are sure to get a glimpse of what life is like living in the countryside

Title: Romantic hillside hideaway with outstanding views
Description: a unique and romantic hideaway quarrymans cottage is dinner on the roof terrace watching the sunset over lyme bay charmouth stargazing from the luxury freestanding bath epic views from the double shower reading under the old oak tree bbqs firepits leisurely walks to the anchor at seatown via golden cap or the coastal path the sound of birdsong the glimpse of a deer curling up in front of the wood burner in winter it is a tranquil heavenly escape from the bustle of daily life the space the spacenquarrymans cottage is a beautiful and newly renovated one bedroom cottage that was built in the mid 1800s it had never previously had mains electric or running waternnsitting over 600 feet above sea level the quarrymans cottage has the most stunning far reaching views of lyme bay lyme regis and charmouth as an upside down house it makes the most of those views the open plan living and kitchen area on the top floor opens via french doors onto a large roof terrace in one direction and a paved terrace in the other the bedroom and large luxury ensuite bathroom are downstairsnnit has been thoughtfully designed to create a light and airy property with large windows in all rooms and french doors also opening out from the bedroom it is south west facing guaranteeing you sun all day and the most wonderful sunsets all year roundnnthe cottage is furnished with an eclectic mix of old and new beautiful vintage wood furniture bought from local antique markets ercol straight back dining chairs sit beside an antique pine table an old headmasters book cupboard has been loving restored to create a pantry cupboard and an old teak ships door found on sanna beach in the scottish highlands over 35 years ago adorns the wall reclaimed pine joists create the floor in the bedroom and upstairs the original pine boards lovingly restored by the owners an oak and powder coated steel spiral staircase from italy takes you between floorsnnthe roof terrace is furnished with a heavy solid wood table and benches plus a bbq there are 2 bulkhead lights which at night illuminate the surrounding trees creating the feeling that you are sitting within themnnthe kitchen is fully kitted out to a high specification with a dishwasher washing machine gas hob electric oven and a gorgeous belfast sink hidden behind an oak worktop allowing for extra worktop space it has everything you need to create fabulous home cooked meals if you opt to eat innnthe living area has a 2 seater sofa side table dining table and chairs a beautiful charnwood woodburner a large window seat a smart tv with built in dvd player and a bluetooth speaker for listening to musicnnthe bedroom has a kingsize solid wood bed hotel quality egyptian cotton sheets and towels two vintage elm chairs for bedside tables a large antique trunk chest of drawers and a window seat with cushions and blanketsnnthe large ensuite bathroom has been fitted to a very high standard a stunning double shower with far reaching views of lyme bay and charmouth a freestanding bath sits across the corner of the room under both windows allowing for a spot of stargazing the freestanding sink sits upon a piece of reclaimed sycamore and the lighting hints at a nautical theme with stylish bulkheads one of which which can also be dimmed allowing for mood lighting whilst taking a bathnnthe garden comprises of various different areas the paved terrace is surrounded by a variety of trees and is a great sun trap the woodland area under two large oaks trees is perfect for lazy afternoons in the shade reading the lawned area gets the sun for the whole of the day is a great spot for sun bathing and of course there is the afore mentioned roof terrace there are two apple trees which provide a constant supply of fruit in the autumnnnthere is currently parking for one car on the lower access levelnnheating during the winter is via the woodburner as well as haverland wave electric radiators with thermostat and timers winter bookings come with a basket of woodnnwell behaved dogs are very welcome guest access guest accessnparking for the cottage is on a tarmac area with space for 2 cars and a turning area shared with guests from the studio the parking bay for the cottage is in front of the cedar fence other things to note other things to notenwest bullen is situated 600 feet above sea level and on a hillside access via verriotts lane is tight in places access via gibbs lane is fine the track leading up to the property is a little rough in places and driving slowly is recommended the driveway into west bullen and to the parking area is short and steep
